Picture of the day
News in Pictures PREV NEXT /images/pic2012/07/thumb/news12_1-600x250.jpg KARACHI: President, Asif Ali Zardari chairs extra-ordinary general meeting of Pakistan Red Crescent Society at Bilawal House in Karachi on Wednesday. -PPI
See details /images/pic2012/07/thumb/news12_2-600x250.jpg ISLAMABAD: prime Minster Raja Pervez Ashraf talking to US Ambassador Cameron Munter who paid farewell call on him at PM House. -APP
See details /images/pic2012/07/thumb/news12_3-600x250.jpg ISLAMABAD: Dr. Muhammad Farooq Sattar, Federal Minister for Overseas Pakistanis distributing cheques to Kuwait, Iraq afectees. -APP
See details /images/pic2012/07/thumb/news12_4-600x250.jpg KABUL: Afghan children from the Mobile Mini Circus for Children (MMCC) sing in Kabul. A German-Canadian couple decided to do a 2-month road trip from Kabul to Istanbul in a rickshaw. Their aim is to raise funds for an Afghan social circus,
See details /images/pic2012/07/thumb/news12_5-600x250.jpg ITALY: Tourists sunbathe as salvage team members work at the rock on the side of the Costa Concordia cruise ship near the harbour of Giglio Porto on July 12, 2012. Salvage crews began work on preparations to refloat the half-submerged Costa Concordia
See details /images/pic2012/07/thumb/news12_6-600x250.jpg MOSCOW: Member of Russia Gymnastics men's team, Nikita Ignatiev (R), performs during a training session outside Moscow, on July 12, 2012. -AFP
See details /images/pic2012/07/thumb/news12_7-600x250.jpg KUMAMOTO: Vehicles are piled-up in a residential area covered in mud after heavy rains fell at Kumamoto city in Japan's southern island of Kyushu on July 12, 2012. At least six people died, 18 were missing and 50,000 ordered to evacuate as the heaviest
See details /images/pic2012/07/thumb/news12_8-600x250.jpg COLOMBO: Sri Lankan journalists protesting harassment of media personnel and independent websites stage a demonstration in Colombo on July 12, 2012. The demonstration came as Sri Lanka announced new laws to crack down against opposition news portals. -AFP
See details /images/pic2012/07/thumb/news12_9-600x250.jpg LAHORE: Loin eats ice to beat the heat due to hot and dry weather at Lahore zoological garden on Wednesday. -PPI

On the Record
Haroon Sharif, Head of the Economic Growth Group, DFID Pakistan
Haroon Sharif is the Head of the Economic Growth Group at the UK’s Department for International Development (DFID). He has over twenty years of international policy experience in the areas of financial sector development, economic policy, regulatory reforms and management in Asia, USA, Europe and the Pacific. He has also provided financial sector ... More...
